result.markdown:
---
title: "Hierarchical clustering"
subtitle: "with scaled cases"
author: "Raphael Saldanha"
date: last-modified
---


This notebooks aims to explore hierarchical clustering of municipalities considering scaled dengue cases time series.

## Packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)
library(arrow)
library(timetk)
library(dtwclust)
library(kableExtra)
library(tictoc)
source("../functions.R")
```
:::


## Load data

Load the bundled data (326 municipalities, pop $\geq$ 100k inhab.) with standardized cases and keep only the municipality code, date and cases variables.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tdengue <- open_dataset(sources = data_dir("bundled_data/tdengue.parquet")) %>%
    select(mun, date, cases) %>%
    collect()
```
:::


## Prepare data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tdengue <- tdengue %>%
  mutate(mun = paste0("m_", mun)) %>%
  arrange(mun, date) %>%
  pivot_wider(names_from = mun, values_from = cases) %>%
  select(-date) %>%
  t() %>%
  tslist()
```
:::


## Clustering


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tic()
clust <- tsclust(
  series = tdengue, 
  type = "hierarchical", 
  k = 5,
  distance = "dtw_basic",
  seed = 123,
  control = hierarchical_control(method = "average")
)
toc()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
10.186 sec elapsed
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggdendro::ggdendrogram(clust, size = .3, labels = F)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](cluster_long_scaled_hier_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
